meanings.definition: Full of incessant activity, excitement, or confusion.
meanings.sent1: The hectical children ran around the playground, laughing and playing.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were hectical with cars honking and people rushing to work.
meanings.sent3: The hectical puppy chased its tail in circles, causing chaos in the living room.
meanings.sent4: Her hectical mind was like a whirlwind, constantly jumping from one thought to another.
meanings.sent5: The hectical market was a vibrant mix of colors, sounds, and smells.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a lot of activity or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The hectical party was filled with music, dancing, and laughter.
meanings.sent2: The amusement park was hectical with children running from ride to ride.
meanings.sent3: The hectical movie kept us on the edge of our seats with its non-stop action.
meanings.sent4: Her hectical energy was contagious, spreading enthusiasm to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The hectical atmosphere of the stadium was electric as fans cheered for their team.

meanings.definition: Full of incessant activity, excitement, or confusion.
meanings.sent1: The hectical classroom buzzed with students asking questions and sharing ideas.
meanings.sent2: The hectical morning rush hour traffic made it hard to get to work on time.
meanings.sent3: The hectical game of tag in the park had everyone running in different directions.
meanings.sent4: Her hectical schedule left little time for relaxation or leisure activities.
meanings.sent5: The hectical festival was a whirlwind of music, food, and performances.
